alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 24 at 4:20AM MST until July 24 at 5:45AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Central Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 545 AM MST. * At 417 AM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Kearny to 14 miles west of Hayden to 13 miles northwest of Oracle, moving west and northwest at 20 to 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind of 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 206 and 225. Route 79 between mile markers 98 and 128. Route 87 between mile markers 116 and 124. Route 177 between mile markers 148 and 158. Locations impacted include... Eloy, Picacho, Chui-Chu, Picacho Peak State Park, Cactus Forest, Shopishk, East Chui-Chu and Kelvin. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
